element-type.name: progressIndicator
element-type.description: The progressIndicator component can be used to give users an understanding that there is a back end task in progress.

attribute-type.name: id
attribute-type.description:
the identifier for the component. The identifier must follow a subset of the syntax allowed in HTML:
  • Must not be a zero-length String.
  • First character must be an ASCII letter (A-Za-z) or an underscore ('_').
  • Subsequent characters must be an ASCII letter or digit (A-Za-z0-9), an underscore ('_'), or a dash ('-').

attribute-type.name: rendered
attribute-type.description: whether the component is rendered. When set to false, no output will be delivered for this component.

attribute-type.name: binding
attribute-type.description: an EL reference that will store the component instance on a bean. This can be used to give programmatic access to a component from a backing bean, or to move creation of the component to a backing bean.

attribute-type.name: attributeChangeListener
attribute-type.description: a method reference to an attribute change listener. Attribute change events are not delivered for any programmatic change to a property. They are only delivered when a renderer changes a property without the application's specific request. An example of an attribute change events might include the width of a column that supported client-side resizing.

attribute-type.name: value
attribute-type.description: The data model being used by this progress component. The model should be of type org.apache.myfaces.trinidad.model.BoundedRangeModel.

attribute-type.name: action
attribute-type.description: A reference to an action method sent by the progress component, or the static outcome of an action. This is invoked when the task under progress is complete.

attribute-type.name: actionListener
attribute-type.description: A method reference to an action listener. This is invoked after the task in progress is complete.

attribute-type.name: immediate
attribute-type.description:
whether data validation - client-side or server-side - will be skipped when events are generated by this component.
When immediate is true, the command's action and ActionListeners, including the default ActionListener provided by the JavaServer Faces implementation, will be executed during Apply Request Values phase of the request processing lifecycle, rather than waiting until the Invoke Application phase. Because validation runs during Process Validators (after Apply Request Values, but before Invoke Application), setting immediate to true will skip validation.

attribute-type.name: inlineStyle
attribute-type.description: the CSS styles to use for this component.

attribute-type.name: styleClass
attribute-type.description: a CSS style class to use for this component.

attribute-type.name: shortDesc
attribute-type.description: The short description of the component. This text is commonly used by user agents to display tooltip help text.

attribute-type.name: partialTriggers
attribute-type.description: the IDs of the components that should trigger a partial update. This component will listen on the trigger components. If one of the trigger components receives an event that will cause it to update in some way, this component will request to be updated too. Identifiers are relative to the source component, and must account for NamingContainers. If your component is already inside of a naming container, you can use a single colon to start the search from the root, or multiple colons to move up through the NamingContainers - "::" will search from the parent naming container, ":::" will search from the grandparent naming container, etc.

element-type.name: resetButton
element-type.description: The reset button control creates a push button which will reset the content of a form.

attribute-type.name: id
attribute-type.description:
the identifier for the component. The identifier must follow a subset of the syntax allowed in HTML:
  • Must not be a zero-length String.
  • First character must be an ASCII letter (A-Za-z) or an underscore ('_').
  • Subsequent characters must be an ASCII letter or digit (A-Za-z0-9), an underscore ('_'), or a dash ('-').

attribute-type.name: rendered
attribute-type.description: whether the component is rendered. When set to false, no output will be delivered for this component.

attribute-type.name: binding
attribute-type.description: an EL reference that will store the component instance on a bean. This can be used to give programmatic access to a component from a backing bean, or to move creation of the component to a backing bean.

attribute-type.name: attributeChangeListener
attribute-type.description: a method reference to an attribute change listener. Attribute change events are not delivered for any programmatic change to a property. They are only delivered when a renderer changes a property without the application's specific request. An example of an attribute change events might include the width of a column that supported client-side resizing.

attribute-type.name: text
attribute-type.description: the textual label of the button.

attribute-type.name: disabled
attribute-type.description: whether the reset button should be disabled.

attribute-type.name: textAndAccessKey
attribute-type.description:
An attribute that will simultaneously set both the "text" and "accessKey" attributes from a single value, using conventional ampersand ('&') notation.

For example, setting this attribute to "T&ext" will set the text to "Text" and the access key to 'e'.

attribute-type.name: accessKey
attribute-type.description:
Character used to gain quick access to this button. For accessibility reasons, this functionality is not supported in screen reader mode.

If the same access key appears in multiple locations in the same page of output, the rendering user agent will cycle among the elements accessed by the similar keys.

This attribute is sometimes referred to as the "mnemonic".

The character specified by this attribute must exist in the Text attribute of this button instance. If it does not, the user will receive no visual indication of the existence of the accessKey. The easiest, and most convenient way to specify both the text and the mnemonic together is to use textAndAccessKey.

attribute-type.name: inlineStyle
attribute-type.description: the CSS styles to use for this component.

attribute-type.name: styleClass
attribute-type.description: a CSS style class to use for this component.

attribute-type.name: shortDesc
attribute-type.description: The short description of the component. This text is commonly used by user agents to display tooltip help text.

attribute-type.name: partialTriggers
attribute-type.description: the IDs of the components that should trigger a partial update. This component will listen on the trigger components. If one of the trigger components receives an event that will cause it to update in some way, this component will request to be updated too. Identifiers are relative to the source component, and must account for NamingContainers. If your component is already inside of a naming container, you can use a single colon to start the search from the root, or multiple colons to move up through the NamingContainers - "::" will search from the parent naming container, ":::" will search from the grandparent naming container, etc.

element-type.name: selectBooleanCheckbox
element-type.description: The selectBooleanCheckbox control is a standard browser input checkbox. It supports displaying a prompt, text, and messages.

attribute-type.name: id
attribute-type.description:
the identifier for the component. The identifier must follow a subset of the syntax allowed in HTML:
  • Must not be a zero-length String.
  • First character must be an ASCII letter (A-Za-z) or an underscore ('_').
  • Subsequent characters must be an ASCII letter or digit (A-Za-z0-9), an underscore ('_'), or a dash ('-').

attribute-type.name: rendered
attribute-type.description: whether the component is rendered. When set to false, no output will be delivered for this component.

attribute-type.name: binding
attribute-type.description: an EL reference that will store the component instance on a bean. This can be used to give programmatic access to a component from a backing bean, or to move creation of the component to a backing bean.

attribute-type.name: attributeChangeListener
attribute-type.description: a method reference to an attribute change listener. Attribute change events are not delivered for any programmatic change to a property. They are only delivered when a renderer changes a property without the application's specific request. An example of an attribute change events might include the width of a column that supported client-side resizing.

attribute-type.name: value
attribute-type.description: the value of the component. If the EL binding for the "value" points to a bean property with a getter but no setter, and this is an editable component, the component will be rendered in read-only mode.

attribute-type.name: converter
attribute-type.description: a converter object

attribute-type.name: immediate
attribute-type.description: whether the value is converted and validated immediately in the Apply Request Values phase, or is handled in the Process Validators phase, the default. By default, values are converted and validated together in the Process Validators phase. However, if you need access to the value of a component during Apply Request Values - for example, if you need to get the value from an actionListener on an immediate commandButton - then setting this to "immediate" makes that possible.

attribute-type.name: required
attribute-type.description: whether a non-null, non-empty value must be entered. If false, validators will not be executed when the value is null or empty.

attribute-type.name: validator
attribute-type.description: a method reference to a validator method

attribute-type.name: valueChangeListener
attribute-type.description: a method reference to an value change listener

attribute-type.name: requiredMessageDetail
attribute-type.description:
the message to be displayed, if 'required' validation fails.

Parameters:

  • {0} the label that identifies the component

attribute-type.name: selected
attribute-type.description: whether or not the component is currently selected. This is a typesafe alias for the "value" attribute.

attribute-type.name: contentStyle
attribute-type.description: the CSS styles to attach to the content of the component. For example, you can set the width of that portion to 100 pixels by setting this attribute to "width: 100px".

attribute-type.name: autoSubmit
attribute-type.description: If set to TRUE on a form element, the component will automatically submit the enclosing form when an appropriate action takes place (a click, text change, etc.).

attribute-type.name: readOnly
attribute-type.description: whether the element is read-only.

attribute-type.name: disabled
attribute-type.description: whether the element is disabled.

attribute-type.name: label
attribute-type.description: the label of the bean.

attribute-type.name: simple
attribute-type.description: a boolean value that controls whether the component provides label and message support; when set to "true", the component will not display messaging support or the label (these attributes may be ignored: label, labelAndAccessKey, accessKey, showRequired, tip), and may use simpler layout primitives

element-type.description: The selectItem tag represents a single item that the user may select from a list, choice, radio, or shuttle Trinidad control.

attribute-type.name: label
attribute-type.description: the user-visible text of the item

attribute-type.name: disabled
attribute-type.description: whether the item is disabled. By default, no items are disabled.

attribute-type.name: longDesc
attribute-type.description: the description associated with this option. This is used in selectManyShuttle and selectOrderShuttle, and ignored otherwise.

attribute-type.name: shortDesc
attribute-type.description: The short description of the bean. This text is commonly used by user agents to display advisory information about the option.

attribute-type.name: contentStyle
attribute-type.description: the CSS styles to attach to the content of the component. For example, you can set the width of that portion to 100 pixels by setting this attribute to "width: 100px".

attribute-type.name: layout
attribute-type.description: whether the control displays the buttons horizontally or vertically.The valid values are "horizontal" and "vertical",the default being "vertical".

attribute-type.name: valuePassThru
attribute-type.description: whether or not the values are passed through to the client. When valuePassThru is false the value and the options' values are converted to indexes before being sent to the client. Therefore, when valuePassThru is false, there is no need to write your own converter when you are using custom Objects as your values and/or options. If you need to know the actual values on the client-side, then you can set valuePassThru to true. This will pass the values through to the client, using your custom converter if it is available; a custom converter is needed if you are using custom objects. The default is false.

Identifiers are relative to the source component, and must account for NamingContainers. If your component is already inside of a naming container, you can use a single colon to start the search from the root, or multiple colons to move up through the NamingContainers - "::" will search from the parent naming container, ":::" will search from the grandparent naming container, etc.

attribute-type.name: onblur
attribute-type.description:
the event handler for the component losing the focus.
This attribute is not supported on the following agent types: pda, phone, voice.

attribute-type.name: onfocus
attribute-type.description:
the event handler for the component gaining the focus.
This attribute is not supported on the following agent types: pda, phone, voice.

attribute-type.name: showRequired
attribute-type.description: whether the associated control displays a visual indication of required user input. If a "required" attribute is also present, both the "required" attribute and the "showRequired" attribute must be false for the visual indication not to be displayed.

attribute-type.name: accessKey
attribute-type.description:
Character used to gain quick access to the form element specified by the for, if set (or this component itself, if it is a "non-simple" form element). For accessibility reasons, this functionality is not supported in screen reader mode. If the same access key appears in multiple locations in the same page of output, the rendering user agent will cycle among the elements accessed by the similar keys.

This attribute is sometimes referred to as the "mnemonic".

attribute-type.name: labelAndAccessKey
attribute-type.description:
An attribute that will simultaneously set both the "value" and "accessKey" attributes from a single value, using conventional ampersand ('&') notation.

For example, setting this attribute to "L&abel" will set the label to "Label" and the access key to 'a'.

attribute-type.name: autoSubmit
attribute-type.description: If set to TRUE on a form element, the component will automatically submit the enclosing form when an appropriate action takes place (a click, text change, etc.).

element-type.name: selectManyListbox
element-type.description: The selectManyListbox component creates a component which allows the user to select many values from a list of items.

attribute-type.name: id
attribute-type.description:
the identifier for the component. The identifier must follow a subset of the syntax allowed in HTML:
  • Must not be a zero-length String.
  • First character must be an ASCII letter (A-Za-z) or an underscore ('_').
  • Subsequent characters must be an ASCII letter or digit (A-Za-z0-9), an underscore ('_'), or a dash ('-').

attribute-type.name: rendered
attribute-type.description: whether the component is rendered. When set to false, no output will be delivered for this component.

attribute-type.name: binding
attribute-type.description: an EL reference that will store the component instance on a bean. This can be used to give programmatic access to a component from a backing bean, or to move creation of the component to a backing bean.

attribute-type.name: attributeChangeListener
attribute-type.description: a method reference to an attribute change listener. Attribute change events are not delivered for any programmatic change to a property. They are only delivered when a renderer changes a property without the application's specific request. An example of an attribute change events might include the width of a column that supported client-side resizing.

attribute-type.name: value
attribute-type.description: the value of the component. If the EL binding for the "value" points to a bean property with a getter but no setter, and this is an editable component, the component will be rendered in read-only mode.

attribute-type.name: converter
attribute-type.description: a converter object

attribute-type.name: immediate
attribute-type.description: whether the value is converted and validated immediately in the Apply Request Values phase, or is handled in the Process Validators phase, the default. By default, values are converted and validated together in the Process Validators phase. However, if you need access to the value of a component during Apply Request Values - for example, if you need to get the value from an actionListener on an immediate commandButton - then setting this to "immediate" makes that possible.

attribute-type.name: required
attribute-type.description: whether a non-null, non-empty value must be entered. If false, validators will not be executed when the value is null or empty.

attribute-type.name: validator
attribute-type.description: a method reference to a validator method

attribute-type.name: valueChangeListener
attribute-type.description: a method reference to an value change listener

attribute-type.name: requiredMessageDetail
attribute-type.description:
the message to be displayed, if 'required' validation fails.

Parameters:

  • {0} the label that identifies the component

attribute-type.name: contentStyle
attribute-type.description: the CSS styles to attach to the content of the component. For example, you can set the width of that portion to 100 pixels by setting this attribute to "width: 100px".

attribute-type.name: size
attribute-type.description: how many items should be visible. Small values may be overridden if the platform cannot render a list of that size correctly.

attribute-type.name: valuePassThru
attribute-type.description: whether or not the values are passed through to the client. When valuePassThru is false the value and the options' values are converted to indexes before being sent to the client. Therefore, when valuePassThru is false, there is no need to write your own converter when you are using custom Objects as your values and/or options. If you need to know the actual values on the client-side, then you can set valuePassThru to true. This will pass the values through to the client, using your custom converter if it is available; a custom converter is needed if you are using custom objects. The default is false.

attribute-type.name: readOnly
attribute-type.description: whether the element is read-only.

attribute-type.name: disabled
attribute-type.description: whether the element is disabled.

attribute-type.name: label
attribute-type.description: the label of the bean.

attribute-type.name: simple
attribute-type.description: a boolean value that controls whether the component provides label and message support; when set to "true", the component will not display messaging support or the label (these attributes may be ignored: label, labelAndAccessKey, accessKey, showRequired, tip), and may use simpler layout primitives

attribute-type.description: event handler for when the value is changed.

attribute-type.description: the CSS styles to use for this component.

attribute-type.name: showRequired
attribute-type.description: whether the associated control displays a visual indication of required user input. If a "required" attribute is also present, both the "required" attribute and the "showRequired" attribute must be false for the visual indication not to be displayed.

attribute-type.name: accessKey
attribute-type.description:
Character used to gain quick access to the form element specified by the for, if set (or this component itself, if it is a "non-simple" form element). For accessibility reasons, this functionality is not supported in screen reader mode. If the same access key appears in multiple locations in the same page of output, the rendering user agent will cycle among the elements accessed by the similar keys.

This attribute is sometimes referred to as the "mnemonic".

attribute-type.name: labelAndAccessKey
attribute-type.description:
An attribute that will simultaneously set both the "value" and "accessKey" attributes from a single value, using conventional ampersand ('&') notation.

For example, setting this attribute to "L&abel" will set the label to "Label" and the access key to 'a'.

attribute-type.name: autoSubmit
attribute-type.description: If set to TRUE on a form element, the component will automatically submit the enclosing form when an appropriate action takes place (a click, text change, etc.).

element-type.name: selectOneRadio

attribute-type.name: id

the identifier for the component. The identifier must follow a subset of the syntax allowed in HTML:

attribute-type.name: rendered
attribute-type.description: whether the component is rendered. When set to false, no output will be delivered for this component.

attribute-type.name: binding
attribute-type.description: an EL reference that will store the component instance on a bean. This can be used to give programmatic access to a component from a backing bean, or to move creation of the component to a backing bean.

attribute-type.name: attributeChangeListener
attribute-type.description: a method reference to an attribute change listener. Attribute change events are not delivered for any programmatic change to a property. They are only delivered when a renderer changes a property without the application's specific request. An example of an attribute change events might include the width of a column that supported client-side resizing.

attribute-type.name: value
attribute-type.description: the value of the component. If the EL binding for the "value" points to a bean property with a getter but no setter, and this is an editable component, the component will be rendered in read-only mode.

attribute-type.name: converter
attribute-type.description: a converter object

attribute-type.name: immediate
attribute-type.description: whether the value is converted and validated immediately in the Apply Request Values phase, or is handled in the Process Validators phase, the default. By default, values are converted and validated together in the Process Validators phase. However, if you need access to the value of a component during Apply Request Values - for example, if you need to get the value from an actionListener on an immediate commandButton - then setting this to "immediate" makes that possible.

attribute-type.name: required
attribute-type.description: whether a non-null, non-empty value must be entered. If false, validators will not be executed when the value is null or empty.

attribute-type.name: contentStyle
attribute-type.description: the CSS styles to attach to the content of the component. For example, you can set the width of that portion to 100 pixels by setting this attribute to "width: 100px".

attribute-type.name: unselectedLabel
attribute-type.description: the label for an additional item that indicates no selection has been made. When the user selects this item, "required" validation will not pass, or a null value will be set if the component is not "required".

attribute-type.name: layout
attribute-type.description: whether the control displays the buttons horizontally or vertically.The valid values are "horizontal" and "vertical", the default being "vertical".

attribute-type.name: valuePassThru
attribute-type.description: whether or not the values are passed through to the client. When valuePassThru is false the value and the options' values are converted to indexes before being sent to the client. Therefore, when valuePassThru is false, there is no need to write your own converter when you are using custom Objects as your values and/or options. If you need to know the actual values on the client-side, then you can set valuePassThru to true. This will pass the values through to the client, using your custom converter if it is available; a custom converter is needed if you are using custom objects. The default is false.

attribute-type.description:

attribute-type.name: value

You may also use other model instances, e.g., java.util.List , array, and javax.faces.model.DataModel. This component will automatically convert the instance into a CollectionModel.

attribute-type.name: rows

attribute-type.name: first
attribute-type.description: the index of the first row in the currently range of rows. This index is zero-based. This attribute is used to control which range of rows to display to the user.

element-type.name: showDetail
element-type.description: The showDetail provides a means of toggling a group of components between being hidden or shown. If the "prompt" facet is present, the component in the facet will be put next to the disclosure icon. If the prompt facet is not present but either the disclosedText or the undisclosedText attributes are set, then the text in that attribute will be displayed next to the disclosure icon. If the prompt facet is not set but both the disclosedText and undisclosedText attributes are set then the disclosedText will be displayed when disclosed="true" and undisclosedText will be displayed when disclosed="false". If the prompt facet is not set and neither the disclosedText or undisclosedText attributes are set, then the label will default to "Hide" for the disclosed text and "Show" for the undisclosed text. For the purposes of EL, setting disclosedText or undisclosedText to null is the same as not setting the value.

attribute-type.description: an EL reference that will store the component instance on a bean. This can be used to give programmatic access to a component from a backing bean, or to move creation of the component to a backing bean.

attribute-type.name: attributeChangeListener
attribute-type.description: a method reference to an attribute change listener. Attribute change events are not delivered for any programmatic change to a property. An example of an attribute change events might include the width of a column that supported client-side resizing.

attribute-type.name: disclosed
attribute-type.description:
whether or not to disclose the children
This attribute is not supported on the following agent types: phone, voice.

attribute-type.name: immediate
attribute-type.description:
whether data validation - client-side or server-side - should be skipped when events are generated by this component.
When immediate is false (the default), the disclosure event will be delivered during the Invoke Application phase, which will trigger validation. When set to true, the disclosure event will be executed during the Apply Request Values phase.

If one of the trigger components receives an event that will cause it to update in some way, this component will request to be updated too. Identifiers are relative to the source component, and must account for NamingContainers. attribute-type.name: messageType
attribute-type.description: Set if an error, info, confirmation, or warning header is needed.

attribute-type.name: size
attribute-type.description: Size of this panelHeader. The largest is 0 and corresponds to an H1 header the smallest is 5 and corresponds to an H6 Header. Note that this version of the tag will display all sizes above 2 the same as size 2. Setting the size to a negative number will allow the header to be calculated according to its parent header. The default value for this property is -1.

attribute-type.name: disabled
attribute-type.description: If value is "true", the component becomes non-interactive. Otherwise,the default value is "false" and component assumes its expected behavior.

attribute-type.name: text
attribute-type.description: the textual label of the showDetailItem.

attribute-type.name: textAndAccessKey
attribute-type.description:
An attribute that will simultaneously set both the "text" and "accessKey" attributes from a single value, using conventional ampersand ('&') notation.

For example, setting this attribute to "T&ext" will set the text to "Text" and the access key to 'e'.

attribute-type.name: accessKey
attribute-type.description:
Character used to gain quick access to this showDetailItem. For accessibility reasons, this functionality is not supported in screen reader mode.

If the same access key appears in multiple locations in the same page of output, the rendering user agent will cycle among the elements accessed by the similar keys.

This attribute is sometimes referred to as the "mnemonic".

attribute-type.name: flex
attribute-type.description: A non-negative integer that indicates the flexibility of this component in its container. If the container supports it, flex is used to determine how space is distributed among its children. Components with larger flex values will be made larger than components with lower flex values. This is done so at the ratio determined by the flex of each of the two components. The actual value is only relevant if there are other flexible components (components with flex values larger than zero) within the same container.

element-type.name: singleStepButtonBar
element-type.description: SingleStepButtonBar renders a Previous button, text describing the current step and the maximum steps, and a Next button.

attribute-type.name: id
attribute-type.description:
the identifier for the component. The identifier must follow a subset of the syntax allowed in HTML:
  • Must not be a zero-length String.
  • First character must be an ASCII letter (A-Za-z) or an underscore ('_').
  • Subsequent characters must be an ASCII letter or digit (A-Za-z0-9), an underscore ('_'), or a dash ('-').

attribute-type.name: rendered
attribute-type.description: whether the component is rendered. When set to false, no output will be delivered for this component.

attribute-type.name: binding
attribute-type.description: an EL reference that will store the component instance on a bean. This can be used to give programmatic access to a component from a backing bean, or to move creation of the component to a backing bean.

attribute-type.name: attributeChangeListener
attribute-type.description: a method reference to an attribute change listener. Attribute change events are not delivered for any programmatic change to a property. They are only delivered when a renderer changes a property without the application's specific request. An example of an attribute change events might include the width of a column that supported client-side resizing.

attribute-type.name: selectedStep
attribute-type.description: the current step. The valid range is 1 to maxStep. It defaults to 1.

attribute-type.name: maxStep
attribute-type.description: the last possible step. If this value is not known, it should be set to MAX_VALUE_UNKNOWN (-1), which is also the default value. If maxStep is MAX_VALUE_UNKNOWN, then no text is rendered between the Back/Next buttons. When maxStep is 2 and selectedStep is 1, then only a Continue button is rendered.

attribute-type.name: previousActionListener
attribute-type.description: a method reference to an action listener that will be called when the singleStep component navigates to the previous step.

attribute-type.name: nextActionListener
attribute-type.description: a method reference to an action listener that will be called when the singleStep component navigates to the next step.

attribute-type.name: nextAction
attribute-type.description: a reference to an action method that will be called when the singleStep component navigates to the next step, or the static outcome of the action.

attribute-type.name: previousAction
attribute-type.description: a reference to an action method that will be called when the singleStep component navigates to the previous step, or the static outcome of the action.

attribute-type.name: text
attribute-type.description: the text description of items being navigated. The default is "Step".

attribute-type.description: the CSS styles to use for this component.

attribute-type.description: a CSS style class to use for this component.

element-type.description: The subform tag represents an independently submittable region of a page. The contents of a subform will only be validated (or otherwise processed) if a component inside of the subform is responsible for submitting the page.

attribute-type.name: id

attribute-type.name: default
attribute-type.description: whether the subform should assume it has been submitted. When set to "default", "submitted" will be considered true if no other subform has been submitted.

element-type.name: table
element-type.description: The Trinidad Table is used to display tabular data. It also supports selection (both single and multiple), sorting, record navigation and detail-disclosure.

attribute-type.name: id
attribute-type.description:
the identifier for the component. The identifier must follow a subset of the syntax allowed in HTML:
  • Must not be a zero-length String.
  • First character must be an ASCII letter (A-Za-z) or an underscore ('_').
  • Subsequent characters must be an ASCII letter or digit (A-Za-z0-9), an underscore ('_'), or a dash ('-').

attribute-type.description: a method reference to an attribute change listener. Attribute change events are not delivered for any programmatic change to a property. They are only delivered when a renderer changes a property without the application's specific request. An example of an attribute change events might include the width of a column that supported client-side resizing.

attribute-type.name: var
attribute-type.description: Name of the EL variable used to reference each element of this collection. Once this component has completed rendering, this variable is removed (or reverted back to its previous value).

attribute-type.name: varStatus
attribute-type.description:
Name of the EL variable used to reference the varStatus information. Once this component has completed rendering, this variable is removed (or reverted back to its previous value). The VarStatus provides contextual information about the state of the component to EL expressions. For components that iterate, varStatus also provides loop counter information. Please see the this component's documentation for the specific properties on the varStatus. The common properties on varStatus include:
  • "model" - returns the CollectionModel for this component
  • "index" - returns the zero based row index

attribute-type.name: value
attribute-type.description: the data model being used by this component. The specific model class is org.apache.myfaces.trinidad.model.CollectionModel. You may also use other model instances, e.g., java.util.List , array, and javax.faces.model.DataModel. This component will automatically convert the instance into a CollectionModel.

attribute-type.name: rows
attribute-type.description: the maximum number of rows to display in a single range of rows. Some ranges might have fewer than the number of rows specified by this attribute (eg: the last range might have an insufficient number of rows). To display all rows at once, set this attribute to 0.

attribute-type.name: first
attribute-type.description: the index of the first row in the currently range of rows. This index is zero-based. This attribute is used to control which range of rows to display to the user.

attribute-type.name: rowDisclosureListener
attribute-type.description: a method reference to an ExpansionListener

attribute-type.name: disclosedRowKeys
attribute-type.description: the set of disclosed rows for this component. Each entry in the set is a rowKey.

attribute-type.name: selectionListener
attribute-type.description: a method reference to a selection listener

attribute-type.name: selectedRowKeys
attribute-type.description: the selection state for this component.

attribute-type.name: immediate
attribute-type.description:
whether or not data validation - client-side or server-side - should take place when events are generated by this component.
When immediate is true, the default ActionListener provided by the JavaServer Faces implementation should be executed during Apply Request Values phase of the request processing lifecycle, rather than waiting until the Invoke Application phase.

attribute-type.name: sortListener
attribute-type.description: a method reference to a sort listener

attribute-type.name: rangeChangeListener
attribute-type.description: a method reference to a rangeChange listener that will be called when a new range is selected.

attribute-type.name: horizontalGridVisible
attribute-type.description: if the horizontal grid lines will be drawn.

attribute-type.name: verticalGridVisible
attribute-type.description: if the vertical grid lines will be drawn.

attribute-type.name: emptyText
attribute-type.description: text displayed when a table is empty.

attribute-type.name: columnBandingInterval
attribute-type.description: the interval between which the column banding alternates. For example, a columnBandingInterval of 1 would display alternately banded columns.

attribute-type.name: rowBandingInterval
attribute-type.description: the interval between which the row banding alternates. For example, rowBandingInterval=1 would displayalternately banded rows in the Grid.

attribute-type.name: rowSelection
attribute-type.description: whether rows in this table selectable. Valid values are "none", "single", "multiple"

attribute-type.name: autoSubmit
attribute-type.description: If set to TRUE on a form element, the component will automatically submit the enclosing form when an appropriate action takes place (a click, text change, etc.). This only takes effect if rowSelection attribute enabled.

attribute-type.name: width
attribute-type.description: the width of the table. The value must either be a number of pixels or a percentage - it is not a CSS width.

attribute-type.name: summary
attribute-type.description: the summary of this table's purpose and structure for user agents rendering to non-visual media.

element-type.name: tree
element-type.description: Represents an interactive tree component.

attribute-type.name: id
attribute-type.description:
the identifier for the component. The identifier must follow a subset of the syntax allowed in HTML:
  • Must not be a zero-length String.
  • First character must be an ASCII letter (A-Za-z) or an underscore ('_').
  • Subsequent characters must be an ASCII letter or digit (A-Za-z0-9), an underscore ('_'), or a dash ('-').

attribute-type.name: rendered
attribute-type.description: whether the component is rendered. When set to false, no output will be delivered for this component.

attribute-type.name: binding
attribute-type.description: an EL reference that will store the component instance on a bean. This can be used to give programmatic access to a component from a backing bean, or to move creation of the component to a backing bean.

attribute-type.name: attributeChangeListener
attribute-type.description: a method reference to an attribute change listener. Attribute change events are not delivered for any programmatic change to a property. They are only delivered when a renderer changes a property without the application's specific request. An example of an attribute change events might include the width of a column that supported client-side resizing.

attribute-type.name: var
attribute-type.description: Name of the EL variable used to reference each element of this collection. Once this component has completed rendering, this variable is removed (or reverted back to its previous value).

attribute-type.name: selectedRowKeys
attribute-type.description: the selection state for this component.

attribute-type.name: immediate
attribute-type.description:
whether or not data validation - client-side or server-side - should take place when events are generated by this component.
When immediate is true, the default ActionListener provided by the JavaServer Faces implementation should be executed during Apply Request Values phase of the request processing lifecycle, rather than waiting until the Invoke Application phase.

attribute-type.name: rowDisclosureListener
attribute-type.description: a method reference to an ExpansionListener

attribute-type.name: disclosedRowKeys
attribute-type.description: the set of disclosed rows for this component. Each entry in the set is a rowKey.

attribute-type.name: selectionListener
attribute-type.description: a method reference to a selection listener

attribute-type.name: varStatus
attribute-type.description:
Name of the EL variable used to reference the varStatus information. Once this component has completed rendering, this variable is removed (or reverted back to its previous value). The VarStatus provides contextual information about the state of the component to EL expressions. For components that iterate, varStatus also provides loop counter information. Please see the this component's documentation for the specific properties on the varStatus. The common properties on varStatus include:
  • "model" - returns the CollectionModel for this component
  • "index" - returns the zero based row index

attribute-type.name: value
attribute-type.description: the hierarchy of tree data - must be of type org.apache.myfaces.trinidad.model.TreeModel

attribute-type.name: focusRowKey
attribute-type.description: the rowKey of the currently focused row. The rowKeys of the ancestor rows of the focus row are added to the expandedRowKeys RowKeySet by default.

attribute-type.name: focusListener
attribute-type.description: a method reference to a focus listener

attribute-type.name: inlineStyle
attribute-type.description: the CSS styles to use for this component.

attribute-type.name: styleClass
attribute-type.description: a CSS style class to use for this component.

attribute-type.name: shortDesc
attribute-type.description: The short description of the component. This text is commonly used by user agents to display tooltip help text.

attribute-type.name: partialTriggers
attribute-type.description: the IDs of the components that should trigger a partial update. This component will listen on the trigger components. If one of the trigger components receives an event that will cause it to update in some way, this component will request to be updated too. Identifiers are relative to the source component, and must account for NamingContainers. If your component is already inside of a naming container, you can use a single colon to start the search from the root, or multiple colons to move up through the NamingContainers - "::" will search from the parent naming container, ":::" will search from the grandparent naming container, etc.

attribute-type.description: an onclick Javascript handler.

element-type.name: treeTable
element-type.description: The Trinidad TreeTable is used to display data that is structured in a hierarchical format.

attribute-type.name: id
attribute-type.description:
the identifier for the component. The identifier must follow a subset of the syntax allowed in HTML:
  • Must not be a zero-length String.
  • First character must be an ASCII letter (A-Za-z) or an underscore ('_').
  • Subsequent characters must be an ASCII letter or digit (A-Za-z0-9), an underscore ('_'), or a dash ('-').

attribute-type.description: whether the component is rendered. When set to false, no output will be delivered for this component.

attribute-type.description: an EL reference that will store the component instance on a bean. This can be used to give programmatic access to a component from a backing bean, or to move creation of the component to a backing bean.

An example of an attribute change events might include the width of a column that supported client-side resizing.

When immediate is true, the default ActionListener provided by the JavaServer Faces implementation should be executed during Apply Request Values phase of the request processing lifecycle, rather than waiting until the Invoke Application phase.

attribute-type.name: rowDisclosureListener
attribute-type.description: a method reference to an ExpansionListener

attribute-type.name: disclosedRowKeys
attribute-type.description: the set of disclosed rows for this component. Each entry in the set is a rowKey.

attribute-type.name: selectionListener
attribute-type.description: a method reference to a selection listener

attribute-type.name: varStatus
attribute-type.description:
Name of the EL variable used to reference the varStatus information. Once this component has completed rendering, this variable is removed (or reverted back to its previous value). The VarStatus provides contextual information about the state of the component to EL expressions. For components that iterate, varStatus also provides loop counter information. Please see the this component's documentation for the specific properties on the varStatus. The common properties on varStatus include:
  • "model" - returns the CollectionModel for this component
  • "index" - returns the zero based row index

attribute-type.name: value
attribute-type.description: the hierarchy of tree data - must be of type org.apache.myfaces.trinidad.model.TreeModel

attribute-type.name: focusRowKey
attribute-type.description: the rowKey of the currently focused row. The rowKeys of the ancestor rows of the focus row are added to the expandedRowKeys RowKeySet by default.

attribute-type.name: focusListener
attribute-type.description: a method reference to a focus listener

attribute-type.name: rowsByDepth
attribute-type.description:
the maximum number of records that can be displayed at one time (range size). Each level of depth in the tree can have a different range size. The first number in the array sets the range size for the root collection. Each subsequent number sets the range size for the corresponding depth. The last number becomes the default for each subsequent level of depth.
If a node has more children than the range size, navigation rows will be rendered above and below the child nodes.

attribute-type.name: rangeChangeListener
attribute-type.description: a method reference to a rangeChange listener that will be called when a new range is selected.

attribute-type.name: horizontalGridVisible
attribute-type.description: if the horizontal grid lines will be drawn.

attribute-type.name: verticalGridVisible
attribute-type.description: if the vertical grid lines will be drawn.

attribute-type.name: emptyText
attribute-type.description: text displayed when a table is empty.

attribute-type.name: columnBandingInterval
attribute-type.description: the interval between which the column banding alternates. For example, a columnBandingInterval of 1 would display alternately banded columns.

attribute-type.name: rowBandingInterval
attribute-type.description: the interval between which the row banding alternates. For example, rowBandingInterval=1 would displayalternately banded rows in the Grid.

attribute-type.name: rowSelection
attribute-type.description: whether rows in this table selectable. Valid values are "none", "single", "multiple"

attribute-type.name: autoSubmit
attribute-type.description: If set to TRUE on a form element, the component will automatically submit the enclosing form when an appropriate action takes place (a click, text change, etc.). This only takes effect if rowSelection attribute enabled.

attribute-type.name: width
attribute-type.description: the width of the table. The value must either be a number of pixels or a percentage - it is not a CSS width.

attribute-type.name: summary
attribute-type.description: the summary of this table's purpose and structure for user agents rendering to non-visual media.

attribute-type.name: inlineStyle
attribute-type.description: the CSS styles to use for this component.

attribute-type.name: styleClass
attribute-type.description: a CSS style class to use for this component.

attribute-type.name: shortDesc
attribute-type.description: The short description of the component. This text is commonly used by user agents to display tooltip help text.

attribute-type.name: partialTriggers
attribute-type.description: the IDs of the components that should trigger a partial update. This component will listen on the trigger components. If one of the trigger components receives an event that will cause it to update in some way, this component will request to be updated too. Identifiers are relative to the source component, and must account for NamingContainers. If your component is already inside of a naming container, you can use a single colon to start the search from the root, or multiple colons to move up through the NamingContainers - "::" will search from the parent naming container, ":::" will search from the grandparent naming container, etc.

attribute-type.name: expandAllEnabled
attribute-type.description: Whether the Expand All, Collapse All links should be rendered.

element-type.name: group
element-type.description: The group component is an invisible control that aggregates semantically-related children; the group itself has no associated client representation (visual or API). Some parent components may have special representation for groups like adding separators around the group but this is a special case and is not always rendered this way. In most cases, only the children of the group will be rendered directly to the page. There will be no layout applied to the children so the natural layout behavior of the underlying HTML elements will apply. If you require a more predictable layout, you should use a layout component such as panelGroupLayout.

attribute-type.name: id
attribute-type.description:
the identifier for the component. The identifier must follow a subset of the syntax allowed in HTML:
  • Must not be a zero-length String.
  • First character must be an ASCII letter (A-Za-z) or an underscore ('_').
  • Subsequent characters must be an ASCII letter or digit (A-Za-z0-9), an underscore ('_'), or a dash ('-').

attribute-type.name: rendered
attribute-type.description: whether the component is rendered. When set to false, no output will be delivered for this component.

attribute-type.name: binding
attribute-type.description: an EL reference that will store the component instance on a bean. This can be used to give programmatic access to a component from a backing bean, or to move creation of the component to a backing bean.

attribute-type.name: attributeChangeListener
attribute-type.description: a method reference to an attribute change listener. Attribute change events are not delivered for any programmatic change to a property. They are only delivered when a renderer changes a property without the application's specific request. An example of an attribute change events might include the width of a column that supported client-side resizing.

element-type.name: iterator
element-type.description: UIXIterator is a component that performs iteration over its child components. It is like a UIXTable without any chrome. While functionally similar to a forEach tag, an iterator is a component that does its processing during rendering, while forEach runs during the assembly of the component tree, and doesn't leave behind a component in the heirarchy.

attribute-type.name: id
attribute-type.description:
the identifier for the component. The identifier must follow a subset of the syntax allowed in HTML:
  • Must not be a zero-length String.
  • First character must be an ASCII letter (A-Za-z) or an underscore ('_').
  • Subsequent characters must be an ASCII letter or digit (A-Za-z0-9), an underscore ('_'), or a dash ('-').

attribute-type.description: whether the component is rendered. When set to false, no output will be delivered for this component.

attribute-type.name: binding
attribute-type.description: an EL reference that will store the component instance on a bean. This can be used to give programmatic access to a component from a backing bean, or to move creation of the component to a backing bean.

attribute-type.name: attributeChangeListener
attribute-type.description: a method reference to an attribute change listener. Attribute change events are not delivered for any programmatic change to a property. They are only delivered when a renderer changes a property without the application's specific request. An example of an attribute change events might include the width of a column that supported client-side resizing.

attribute-type.name: var
attribute-type.description: Name of the EL variable used to reference each element of this collection. Once this component has completed rendering, this variable is removed (or reverted back to its previous value).

attribute-type.name: varStatus
attribute-type.description:
Name of the EL variable used to reference the varStatus information. Once this component has completed rendering, this variable is removed (or reverted back to its previous value). The VarStatus provides contextual information about the state of the component to EL expressions. For components that iterate, varStatus also provides loop counter information. Please see the this component's documentation for the specific properties on the varStatus. The common properties on varStatus include:
  • "model" - returns the CollectionModel for this component
  • "index" - returns the zero based row index

attribute-type.name: value
attribute-type.description: the data model being used by this component. The specific model class is org.apache.myfaces.trinidad.model.CollectionModel. You may also use other model instances, e.g., java.util.List , array, and javax.faces.model.DataModel. This component will automatically convert the instance into a CollectionModel.

attribute-type.name: rows
attribute-type.description: the maximum number of rows to display in a single range of rows. Some ranges might have fewer than the number of rows specified by this attribute (eg: the last range might have an insufficient number of rows). To display all rows at once, set this attribute to 0.

attribute-type.name: first
attribute-type.description: the index of the first row in the currently range of rows. This index is zero-based. This attribute is used to control which range of rows to display to the user.

element-type.name: switcher
element-type.description: The switcher component dynamically decides which facet component should be rendered.

attribute-type.name: id
attribute-type.description:
the identifier for the component. The identifier must follow a subset of the syntax allowed in HTML:
  • Must not be a zero-length String.
  • First character must be an ASCII letter (A-Za-z) or an underscore ('_').
  • Subsequent characters must be an ASCII letter or digit (A-Za-z0-9), an underscore ('_'), or a dash ('-').

attribute-type.name: rendered
attribute-type.description: whether the component is rendered. When set to false, no output will be delivered for this component.

attribute-type.name: binding
attribute-type.description: an EL reference that will store the component instance on a bean. This can be used to give programmatic access to a component from a backing bean, or to move creation of the component to a backing bean.

attribute-type.name: attributeChangeListener
attribute-type.description: a method reference to an attribute change listener. Attribute change events are not delivered for any programmatic change to a property. They are only delivered when a renderer changes a property without the application's specific request. An example of an attribute change events might include the width of a column that supported client-side resizing.

attribute-type.name: facetName
attribute-type.description: the name of the facet to render and process.

attribute-type.name: defaultFacet
attribute-type.description: the name of the facet to render and process if "facetName" is null or otherwise does not refer to an existing facet.

element-type.name: convertColor
element-type.description: Converts an string, to and from java.awt.Color objects.

attribute-type.name: id
attribute-type.description: the identifier for the converter

attribute-type.name: patterns
attribute-type.description: The set of acceptable patterns, as a whitespace sepa rated list. The first pattern in the list will be used for formatting java.awt.Color values. All patterns will be tried in order to convert Strings back into java.awt.Colors. If no patterns are set, the default is "#RRGGBB r,g,b".

attribute-type.name: transparentAllowed
attribute-type.description: Whether the converter should allow generation of a " transparent" color (a black color with an alpha of zero). The converter uses a String version of "transparent" that is translated for the user's locale.

attribute-type.name: messageDetailConvert
attribute-type.description:
Custom error message to be used, for creating detail part of faces message, when users input does not match the specified pattern.

Parameters:

  • {0} the label that identifies the component
  • {1} value entered by the user
  • {2} the pattern the converter is expecting

element-type.name: convertDateTime
element-type.description: Converts string into java.util.Date and vice versa based on the pattern and style set.

attribute-type.name: id
attribute-type.description: the identifier for the converter

attribute-type.name: messageDetailConvertDate
attribute-type.description:
Custom error message to be used, for creating detail part of faces message, for values that cannot be converted to date when the pattern / secondary pattern is set or when type is set to 'date' and pattern is not set or is null.

Parameters:

  • {0} the label that identifies the component
  • {1} value entered by the user
  • {2} an example of the format the converter is expecting

attribute-type.name: messageDetailConvertTime
attribute-type.description:
Custom error message to be used, for creating detail part of faces message, for time based value that cannot be converted to date when type is set to 'time', pattern is not set or is null

Parameters:

  • {0} the label that identifies the component
  • {1} value entered by the user
  • {2} an example of the format the converter is expecting

attribute-type.name: messageDetailConvertBoth
attribute-type.description:
Custom error message to be used, for creating detail part of faces message, for date-time based value that cannot be converted to date when type is set to 'both' and pattern is not set or is null.

Parameters:

  • {0} the label that identifies the component
  • {1} value entered by the user
  • {2} an example of the format the converter is expecting

attribute-type.name: dateStyle
attribute-type.description: Predefined formatting style which determines how the date component of a date string is to be formatted and parsed. Applied only if type is "date" or "both". Valid values are "shortish", "short", "default", "medium", "long", and "full". Default value is "shortish".

attribute-type.name: locale
attribute-type.description: Locale whose predefined styles for dates and times are used during formatting or parsing. If not specified or if null, the Locale returned by FacesContext.getViewRoot().getLocale() will be used.

attribute-type.name: pattern
attribute-type.description: Custom formatting pattern which determines how the date/time string should be formatted and parsed.

attribute-type.name: secondaryPattern
attribute-type.description: Second pattern, which will be used as a second attempt to parse a string if the primary pattern or styles fail, but is never used for formatting strings.

attribute-type.name: timeStyle
attribute-type.description: Predefined formatting style which determines how the time component of a date string is to be formatted and parsed. Applied only if type is "time" or "both". Valid values are "default", "short", "medium", "long", and "full". Default value is "short".

attribute-type.name: timeZone
attribute-type.description: Time zone in which to interpret any time information in the date string. If not set here, picks this value from trinidad-config.xml configuration file. If not defined there, then it is defaulted to GMT.

attribute-type.name: type
attribute-type.description: Specifies what contents the string value will be formatted to include, or parsed. Valid values are "date", "time", and "both". Default value is "date".

element-type.name: convertNumber
element-type.description: Converts an string to a Number and vice versa based on the 'pattern' or the 'type' set.

attribute-type.name: id
attribute-type.description: the identifier for the converter

attribute-type.name: currencyCode
attribute-type.description: The ISO 4217 currency code, applied only when formatting currencies. Currency code can also be set for the entire application in trinidad-config.xml file. If currency code is not set on the converter, and if set on trinidad-config.xml configuration file it will be used by calling RequestContext().getCurrenctInstance().getCurrencyCode(). This currency code will be used during call to getAsString() for formatting, provided type is set to 'currency'.

attribute-type.name: messageDetailConvertCurrency
attribute-type.description:
Custom error message to be used, for creating detail part of the FacesMessage, when value cannot be converted to a number, when type is set to 'currency' and pattern is null or not set.

Parameters:

  • {0} the label that identifies the component
  • {1} value entered by the user

attribute-type.name: messageDetailConvertNumber
attribute-type.description:
Custom error message to be used, for creating detail part of the FacesMessage, when value cannot be converted to a number, when type is set to 'number' and pattern is null or not set.

Parameters:

  • {0} the label that identifies the component
  • {1} value entered by the user

attribute-type.name: messageDetailConvertPattern
attribute-type.description:
Custom error message to be used, for creating detail part of the FacesMessage message, when value cannot be converted to a number, based on the pattern set.

Parameters:

  • {0} the label that identifies the component
  • {1} value entered by the user
  • {2} the specified conversion pattern

attribute-type.name: messageDetailConvertPercent
attribute-type.description:
Custom error message to be used, for creating detail part of the FacesMessage, when value cannot be converted to a number, when type is set to 'percent' and pattern is null or not set.

Parameters:

  • {0} the label that identifies the component
  • {1} value entered by the user

attribute-type.name: currencySymbol
attribute-type.description: Currency symbol, is applied only when formatting currencies. If currency code is set then symbol will be ignored.

attribute-type.name: groupingUsed
attribute-type.description: Flag specifying whether formatted output will contain grouping separators. Default value is true.

attribute-type.name: integerOnly
attribute-type.description: Flag specifying whether only the integer part of the value will be formatted and parsed. Default value is false.

attribute-type.name: locale
attribute-type.description: Locale whose predefined styles for numbers are used during formatting and parsing. If not specified, the Locale returned by FacesContext.getViewRoot().getLocale() will be used.

attribute-type.name: maxFractionDigits
attribute-type.description: Maximum number of digits that will be formatted in the fractional portion of the output.

attribute-type.name: maxIntegerDigits
attribute-type.description: Maximum number of digits that will be formatted in the integer portion of the output.

attribute-type.name: minFractionDigits
attribute-type.description: Minimum number of digits that will be formatted in the fractional portion of the output.

attribute-type.name: minIntegerDigits
attribute-type.description: Minimum number of digits that will be formatted in the integer portion of the output.

attribute-type.name: pattern
attribute-type.description: Custom formatting pattern which determins how the number string should be formatted and parsed.

attribute-type.name: type
attribute-type.description: Specifies how the number string will be formatted and parsed. Valid values are "number", "currency", and "percent". Default value is "number".

element-type.name: validateByteLength
element-type.description: Validate the byte length of strings when encoded.

attribute-type.name: id
attribute-type.description: the identifier for the validator

attribute-type.name: maximum
attribute-type.description: maximum number of allowable bytes when the string is encoded

attribute-type.name: encoding
attribute-type.description: the Java encoding used for the string.

attribute-type.name: messageDetailMaximum
attribute-type.description:
Custom error message to be used, for creating detail part of faces message, when conversion fails for input that exceeds the maximum byte length.

Parameters:

  • {0} the label that identifies the component
  • {1} value entered by the user
  • {2} the maximum length

element-type.name: validateDateRestriction
element-type.description: Validate that the date entered is within a given restriction.

attribute-type.name: id
attribute-type.description: the identifier for the validator

attribute-type.name: invalidMonths
attribute-type.description: Specify the month which are invalid for your use case. The attribute takes a whitespace delimited list of months. Possible values are jan, feb, mar, apr, may, jun, jul, aug, sep, oct, nov, dec.

attribute-type.name: invalidDaysOfWeek
attribute-type.description: Specify the weekdays which are invalid for your use case. The attribute takes whitespace delimited list of weekdays. Possible values are sun, mon, tue, wed, thu, fri, sat.

attribute-type.name: invalidDays
attribute-type.description: To specifiy a concrete List of Dates, use the invalidDays attribute and wire it to a DateListProvider implementation. This returns a list of dates, which are invalid.

attribute-type.name: messageDetailInvalidMonths
attribute-type.description:
The detail error message to be used for constructing faces messages, when input value exceeds the invalidMonths value set.

Parameters:

  • {0} the label that identifies the component
  • {1} value entered by the user
  • {2} the invalid month

attribute-type.name: messageDetailInvalidDaysOfWeek
attribute-type.description:
The detail error message to be used for constructing faces messages, when input value is less than the set invalidDaysOfWeek value.

Parameters:

  • {0} the label that identifies the component
  • {1} value entered by the user
  • {2} the invalid weekday

attribute-type.name: messageDetailInvalidDays
attribute-type.description:
The detail error message to be used for constructing faces messages, when input value is less than the set invalidDate value.

Parameters:

  • {0} the label that identifies the component
  • {1} value entered by the user
  • {2} the invalid date

element-type.name: validateDateTimeRange
element-type.description: Validate that the date entered is within a given range.

attribute-type.name: id
attribute-type.description: the identifier for the validator

attribute-type.name: maximum
attribute-type.description: the maximum java.util.Date. ISO 8601 date strings, of the form 'yyyy-MM-dd' (for example 2004-06-22) is also allowed. This will be parsed to date.

attribute-type.name: minimum
attribute-type.description: The minimum java.util.Date. ISO 8601 date strings, of the form 'yyyy-MM-dd' (for example 2004-06-22) are also allowed. This will be parsed to date.

attribute-type.name: messageDetailMaximum
attribute-type.description:
The detail error message to be used for constructing faces messages, when input value exceeds the maximum value set.

Parameters:

  • {0} the label that identifies the component
  • {1} value entered by the user
  • {2} the maximum allowed date

attribute-type.name: messageDetailMinimum
attribute-type.description:
The detail error message to be used for constructing faces messages, when input value is less than the set minimum value.

Parameters:

  • {0} the label that identifies the component
  • {1} value entered by the user
  • {2} the minimum allowed date

attribute-type.name: messageDetailNotInRange
attribute-type.description:
The detail error message to be used for constructing faces messages, if input value is not with in the range, when minimum and maximum is set.

  • {0} the label that identifies the component
  • {1} value entered by the user
  • {2} the minimum allowed date
  • {3} the maximum allowed date
